simplified: Your dreams might show you things that you didn't know were on your mind. Some common dreams, like flying or falling, can mean the same thing for most people. To understand what they mean to you, think about how they relate to your daily life.

Moscow has many wild dogs living in the city. There are about 35,000 dogs. Some were born wild, while others used to be pets but their owners left them. Some dogs live alone and some live with friends. Scientists studied the dogs in 2010 and found that they have learned to live well in the city. They know it's safer to cross the street with people and some dogs even understand traffic lights.

Wonder is a book written by RJ Palacio. She got the idea for it after seeing a girl with a special face one day. Wonder has been very popular in America and has won some awards. Many schools use it to talk about bullying, friendship, and being different. A movie version is coming soon!

Chloe has two pet rats named Zena and Roxy. People often don't think rats make good pets, but Chloe knows they're nice if you take care of them. She understands why people are surprised when she tells them about her rats. Before, Chloe didn't like rats either. But then her friend Martin showed her his rats and she saw how friendly and smart they were. When one of Martin's rats had babies last year, Chloe decided to keep two of them.

Cape Town can be a problem for baboons. Some get hurt or die in car accidents and others get shocked when they play with electric wires. Baboons are rare animals and we need to help them. The city council has hired people called Baboon Monitors to move baboons out of the city or catch them and take them back to nature. This plan is working a little, but it's hard to keep baboons from coming back to the city because they think it's an easy place to find food.

I work for a big IT company that has its main office in America. Because of this, I do my job from home and work online. This is good because it saves me time and I don't have to talk to colleagues just for fun. I work on specific projects and like being able to take breaks when my kids need me for school events or doctor's appointments. The only problem is that without a set schedule, I often stay up late finishing tasks and might miss dinner.

In the 1990s, people kept writing on walls (graffiti). But there was also a lot more art on streets everywhere. Some artists made pictures that tried to tell people about important issues like war and unfairness. Other artists just wanted to make pretty things. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor areas making the grey city walls colourful and beautiful.

Social media, magazines and shop windows show people lots of things to buy every day. British people are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. It's easy to buy online without thinking about it. Big brands sell cheap clothes that can be used a few times and then thrown away.

Sam looked away from the sun to see the car driving up to the big house. The horses were swatting flies with their tails, not paying attention to Mr Carter's visit after ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter didn't come out here unless he had to. That was okay with Sam. He wanted to keep his job. If he stayed out of trouble, he would have a job for longer.

Many people in Berlin don't like hunting pigs because they think it's cruel. There were big arguments between hunters and animal lovers. The city council listened to their complaints and decided on a new plan. Instead of shooting pigs, they built fences around them and made it illegal to feed the pigs. We'll have to wait and see if this works.

Suzanne Collins liked stories from ancient Greece when she was little. One story she loved was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens is controlled by Crete. The Athenians get angry and rebel. As punishment, they have to send 14 young people to Crete every year. They are eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But one of them, named Theseus, fights the Minotaur and wins. Suzanne thinks Katniss Everdeen is like a modern-day Theseus.

Zoos help people learn about conservation. They can inspire us to protect animals and their homes. Some zoos give a safe home to animals that were hurt in circuses or abandoned pets. Zoos also study animal behavior and how to make animals healthy.

There is a new trend against buying things – 'buy nothing'. This idea started in Canada many years ago and then came to America. People don't like how much we spend on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On this special day, people protest by cutting up their credit cards. All year round, groups of people share and fix the things they already have.

Graffiti: art or trouble? Some people think it's art, but many governments see it as bad behavior. If you write or paint on walls without permission, you might get in trouble with the police. They can fine you and make you clean up your mess. Cities spend a lot of money to remove graffiti from buildings and vehicles.

Graffiti and street art: what do people in the art world think? Some people now see it as important art. There have been big shows about street art in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. One American artist named Elura Emerald showed street art at a gallery in New York in 2008. She said that artists who paint on streets are just expressing themselves and not hurting anyone. They should be liked and praised.

Most people have four to six dreams each night after they turn 10 years old. That means they can have around 2,000 dreams every year. By the time they're 80 years old, they might have had 140,000 dreams! Even if we forget most of our dreams, that's still a few thousand memories left. It's not hard to believe that sometimes, what happens in our dreams can happen in real life too.

The Hunger Games happens in the future when North America is gone. The country is called Panem and has 12 poor areas. These areas are controlled by the rich city, Capitol. The Capitol has all the power. Each area makes something for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, gives all the coal to the country. A long time ago, there was a 13th district but they rebelled against the Capitol and were destroyed.

Wild animals sometimes go to cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons are coming into homes on the outskirts of the city to eat. They open trash cans and take fruit from gardens and yards. Some brave baboons even enter houses and take food from kitchens! However, some baboons can be mean and have hurt many pet animals. This makes many people in the city unhappy about their presence.

Many accidents happen while building bridges. These accidents often happen because engineers make mistakes. For example, they might calculate something wrong. The bridge falls down and can be very dangerous for people working on it.

George Lucas made movies based on a special story plan. This plan has 17 steps. Usually, the main character lives a normal life, but something happens and they go on an adventure that changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke is just living with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. Then he finds a message from Princess Leia for Obi-Wan Kenobi inside a robot named R2D2. This starts Luke's big journey.

Another idea to stop an asteroid from hitting Earth is to blow it up with a nuclear bomb. One way to stop an asteroid from hitting Earth is to use a big explosion, like a nuclear bomb. NASA has even thought about doing this. They would fire special rockets at the asteroid to try and change its course. If that doesn't work, they would add a nuclear bomb to make it explode.

Campbell says that heroes start by saying no to adventure, but then someone helps them make up their minds. They decide to go on an adventure into a new place where exciting things happen. Next, they have to pass some tests and fight against bad people while making friends along the way. Luke's helper is Obi-Wan, his friends are Han Solo and robots R2D2 and C3PO, and the bad guy is Darth Vader in the special world of the Death Star.

Underused things might seem useless to some people, but they can be useful for others. The internet has helped groups of friends share these underused things and make money from them. Now, it's easy to buy and sell old things through websites and social media groups. This is called the sharing economy.

Dreams were important in the 18th and 19th centuries. Some people thought that dreams show us things we don't know about ourselves. Freud believed that if we understand our dreams, we can learn more about our feelings and problems. But others had a different idea. They thought that dreams are just random thoughts in our brain while it's remembering the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these thoughts and create a story.

I'm a freelancer. This is good because I can decide what I do and how I spend my time. At first, I worked from home but it was hard to concentrate. There were too many distractions: housework, TV, family asking for help. So I started going to a café nearby to work. But the Wi-Fi wasn't great and I drank too much coffee. Now I rent a desk in a shared office with other freelancers like me. I like getting dressed and focusing on my work.

NASA needs money to build a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope will help find small asteroids in space. If they get the money, it might take them 10 years to finish the job. After that, they'll have to figure out how to protect Earth from really big and scary asteroids.

The 'buy nothing' idea is popular now on social media. Some famous people share things they like and think others should buy them. But some YouTube stars say we shouldn't buy anything for a long time. Two friends in Canada tried not buying things like clothes, food, or household items for a year. First, they learned to live without buying things like TVs, phones, and furniture. Then, they stopped using services like haircuts, eating out, and filling up their car's gas tank. After one year, they had saved $55,000.

Pi likes religion. His family is Hindu, but he wants to know more about other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi says he is both Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one, Pi says 'I want to love God'. His family and teachers let him decide for himself.

Some people think writing down what you want can help you have more control over your dreams. Lucid dreaming means being aware you're dreaming and making choices about what happens in your dream. This could be useful - you might turn a scary dream into a peaceful one or even direct the story of your dream like a movie director.

People might not know they're part of the problem with old clothes because they give them to charity shops. But these shops can't always sell all those unwanted clothes. 'Fast fashion' is popular for a short time, then it's no longer wanted and often isn't good enough to be recycled. People don't want to buy old clothes, so many are thrown away. A lot of clothes that charities can't sell are sent to other countries, causing more problems.

Some people like to go on many adventures. Meagan McGrath from Canada did some amazing things. She climbed big mountains, rode a bike across Canada, and ran in a hot desert. But her most exciting trip was to the South Pole by skiing. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and had to be helped out. Many people would have stopped then, but Meagan kept going. It took her 40 days to get to the South Pole. She pulled a big sled with a tent and food behind her through cold weather and snowstorms.

Blek le Rat started painting rats on walls in his hometown Paris. Now, he wants people to think about important issues. He draws pictures of people without homes in big cities to remind people that there is a problem with homelessness.

Some places have special areas for artists to paint graffiti legally. Taiwan is one example. There are 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint and write freely. In Brazil, São Paulo allows some artists to paint on their subway trains.

Faith47 comes from South Africa. She paints big pictures of people and animals. She likes to find new places to paint. Her art can be found on walls, in old buildings, and on cars. Faith47 thinks it's cool that street art doesn't last forever. It gets washed away or removed by the city. This reminds her that life is always changing.

Gabriela worked in a place where people respected those in charge. Leaders made important decisions and weren't often questioned. But her Swedish team was different. They liked working together with their bosses to solve problems and make choices. Their leaders acted like helpers who wanted new ideas and were open to being challenged.

Gabriela noticed some differences between her and her team. She talked to them about their feelings. They said they liked having more freedom to make decisions. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt she didn't trust them. They explained that it was just how they worked.
Os Gêmeos are two brothers from Brazil. They make art on buildings and walls. Sometimes their paintings are very big! They need special machines to help them finish.

People have been writing and drawing on walls for a long time. In olden days, people in Africa and Europe drew pictures of animals and people in caves. We can still see graffiti on ancient buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq today. Even in the old Roman town of Pompeii, archaeologists found many examples of writing on walls. These messages were about love, politics, and even magic!

Have you ever wanted to climb Mount Everest or walk to the South Pole? Many people do! Every year, lots of people try to climb big mountains or walk across countries. They don't use old maps like explorers used to; they have new technology like GPS and phones that help them. Some people love nature and travel to help protect it. Others want to help people in need and raise money for good causes.
There's a special test called DART. It will be tested near an asteroid named Didymos.

Katniss Everdeen is the main character of the story. She's only 16 years old. Her father died in an accident, so she has to help her family by hunting in the woods. She's very good with a bow and arrow. When her little sister Prim gets chosen for a special competition, Katniss decides to go instead. The other person from District 12 is a boy named Peeta. Katniss starts to feel confused about her feelings towards him.

Writing about my dreams helps me remember more details. Think about who was there and where it happened, as this might help make sense of the dream too. After a week, you'll be surprised at how much you've written down. Then, you can start to connect your dreams with things that happen in your daily life.
Long ago, many bridges were made of wood. They were more likely to catch fire and get damaged.

Street art is changing and growing. Many young artists paint in their city or town, but some are now traveling and working all over the world. Artists are also using the internet to share photos of their work and talk to each other. The art world is starting to see street art as a real form of art. We don't know what will happen next, but we can be sure that street art is here to stay!

Suzanne Collines finds war news scary. When she was little, her dad was a pilot in the US Air Force and he went to Vietnam. Her mom tried to hide the truth from her, but Suzanne still saw TV news about the war and knew her dad was there. It was very frightening for her.

PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) did a big survey. They asked many people about work. More than 40,000 people answered questions about how they like their job and what's important to them. Separate from that, Deloitte also did a survey. Many millennials (people born between 1983 and 1993) shared their thoughts on the good things and bad things in the world of work.

Erik Weihenmayer is an adventurer from America. He has done many exciting things like cycling in Morocco, kayaking in the Grand Canyon, and climbing Mount Everest. Erik has been blind since he was 13 years old. Besides his travels, he helps people with disabilities to be active and takes groups of young blind people on hiking trips.

Online platforms are helping people make money quickly. For example, busy parents used to find it hard to sell old toys or clothes from their kids. Now they can use online shops and sell things like hardly worn baby clothes and old pushchairs.

Pi and Richard Parker are on a lifeboat for 227 days. They face many challenges like hunger, sickness, and tiredness. The weather is also very rough with big storms and hot sun. Pi feels happy when he thinks about his three religions, but sometimes he's very sad and lonely. Then, they see the Mexican coast coming closer. That changes everything! You'll have to read the book to find out what happens next.

Chloe got home from school and made some coffee. Then she went upstairs to her bedroom. She had homework, but it could wait. Chloe wanted to relax for a bit before her parents came home. She liked this quiet time because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA found most big asteroids near Earth. These 'near-Earth objects' are as tall as mountains and include things close to our planet's path. NASA has found many - 887 in total. They say none of these are a threat to Earth.

Auggie wants to go to school. He's nervous because it's his first day. Everyone looks at him funny because he's different. Nobody wants to sit with him. But then he meets Jack and Summer, who become his friends. It's not just the first day that's hard. Some kids are scared of Auggie because they think he has a disease. Throughout the year, Auggie faces many tough times until something big happens at school camp.

Two men looked towards the north part of the land. It went on forever. Even the fences were hard to see from where they stood. No matter how bored or unhappy a teenager might be, it was impossible to run away. Sam looked at the biggest horse and wondered if the boy could ride it. There would be big problems for someone who didn't know about horses and wanted to get away from their dad.

Over 4,000 climbers have reached the top of Everest. Climbing high mountains is still very dangerous. Now, the best climbers look for new adventures. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria loves mountain climbing. She started when she was a teenager. After school, she became a nurse and kept climbing in her spare time.

Gerlinde climbed Everest, then decided to climb all 14 peaks that are over 8,000 meters high. She makes it more difficult by not using oxygen tanks. This is dangerous because there isn't enough air at those heights. Gerlinde uses her fame to help a charity for poor children and orphans in Nepal.

We buy things and sometimes they don't get used. Think about it: you might have a big coat for cold weather but you live in a hot place, or a phone that you stopped using when you got a new one. You might even have a car that only goes out on weekends. And maybe your guest room is now just a storage space.

Dreams have been important for a long time. People thought that dreams were messages from the gods. They believed that dreams could tell us things we didn't know before. Some people remember having a dream about something, and then it happened in real life later on.

Some big and costly projects build bridges. Bridges are very important because they help cars, trucks, and trains cross rivers, mountains or other roads. If they break, people look very closely to see what went wrong.

Gabriela was very frustrated for weeks. She sent an email to her boss about the problems she had with her team. Her boss asked if everything was still okay and what Gabriela thought would help her work better with her team.

Dogs in packs know humans give food to cute dogs. They send small dogs to beg for food and even use the metro to move around their territory! Scientists are trying to figure out how they get off at the right stop. Maybe it's because of their great sense of smell or maybe they recognize station names from announcements. Either way, people on the train don't notice them anymore.

Ed Stafford from England walked along the Amazon River. He started near some small mountains in Peru and finished at the river's mouth in Brazil after two years and four months. He walked for 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon rainforest has snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars that can be dangerous. But Ed was safe because he didn't get hurt badly.

In Britain, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about 4% of their income. This might not seem like much, but it hides two big problems for society and the environment. First, many people buy things using credit cards. Adults in Britain owe around £670 to these companies. That's almost all of what they spend on clothes. Second, people are buying things they don't need and throwing them away. Every year, Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes, most of which ends up in landfills.

Ed needed technology to make his walk possible. He used a radio to ask people in the rainforest for food and permission to pass through their land. Some of them came to meet him and helped guide him through tough terrain. Ed wrote about his journey on a blog, sharing what he did every day. He used the attention from the media to talk about the problems with the rainforest and raise money for good causes in Brazil and Peru.

Companies are making money from sharing things they don't use. One way they do this is by creating a website that helps people find what they need or want. For example, Airbnb lets people rent out their empty rooms and houses to travelers. Another example is Uber, which allows people to use their own cars as taxis to earn some extra money.
Zoos help endangered animals by breeding them. Zoos help save rare animals by helping them have babies.

Both kinds of accidents are rare, but boats and trains can cause bridges to collapse for different reasons. Trains can make a bridge fall down if they go too fast. Boats can also make it fall even if they're going slow because they're very heavy. The best way to stop bridges from falling is to plan ahead. New technologies that find weak spots, safer workplaces and better designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.

Pi was scared of the animals at first. He jumped into the ocean, but then he remembered there were sharks. So he got back into the lifeboat. The animals started killing each other one by one until only Pi and a tiger were left. Luckily, the tiger was sick and didn't want to eat him.

Pi is 16 when there is a new government. His parents don't like it. They are worried about the future. So they decide to close the zoo and go to Canada. Some animals go to other zoos in North America. Pi and his family sail to Canada with the animals. But then there's a big storm. The ship sinks. Sadly, everyone on the ship dies. Pi is left alone in a lifeboat with some animals: a hyena, zebra, orang-utan and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a popular book written by Suzanne Collins. She is an American author who wrote it for teenagers and young adults. The book was published in 2008 and has been translated into many languages. It has sold millions of copies worldwide. This book was also the first to sell over one million electronic copies. Now, it's a big movie too!

Dreams might be how our mind sorts out things we think about during the day. But when we dream, these thoughts come with special meanings. When we're awake, our thoughts are like conversations in our head. But when we sleep, the part of our brain that helps us talk becomes quieter while the part that makes us feel emotions gets stronger.

Having good friendships makes you happy. Research shows that most happy people have close friends and family they spend time with. It's also important to have one person you can talk openly with, like 'self-disclosure'. You don't need many friends, just someone special for deep conversations. Having lots of friends is not enough if you don't have a strong connection with them. Some people need to learn how to listen better to build stronger friendships.

Carol Dweck says our brains can change and we can learn new things even if we're not good at them at first. We often praise people for their natural talents, like 'You're really good at this!' But research shows that praising how someone does something - like trying hard or solving problems - helps us get better at things and keep improving.

The rover on Mars checks the air around it sometimes. In 2014, it found something important: methane. Methane only lasts for a few hundred years. This means that something on Mars is making more methane. NASA says that Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at one time. The amount of methane goes up and down with the seasons.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist from Stanford University, gave some problems to 10-year-old kids that were just a little too hard. Some of the kids liked the challenge and thought they could get better. They had a 'growth mindset' and wanted to do well in the future. But other kids felt like their intelligence was being tested and they failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and couldn't imagine getting better. Some of them might cheat next time, while others looked for someone who did worse than them to feel good about themselves.

Horror movies like deserted areas. This could be an old hospital, a spooky empty house or a ghost town. There's something about quiet places with nobody around. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that these places are very quiet and can be scary because of that.

Basement is scary in horror movies. Something bad is usually hiding or hidden tools are found there. Basements are dark and often wet. You can only go down by a small staircase. Even if nothing is there, basements feel creepy.

Gary Collins, an off-duty policeman, watched TV news about London riots. He saw people he knew and went back early to help. He looked at CCTV footage for six months and found 190 people. His help was very important in solving the case.

I think it's cool to think about how we can make ourselves better. Imagine if we could put a computer in our brain! It will soon be possible and we'll be able to do things like remember better, see more clearly, and understand math better.

The speaker gave an interesting talk. She said that parents have a big influence on their teenagers. For example, if parents are always on their phones, it's no surprise that their kids do the same thing. The speaker also talked about people wanting to be in two places at once. They like to chat with friends online while still being in the real world. I see this happen all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends.

The news can make us think the world is getting more violent. But there are also good things to say. In the past, from World War II until 1990, there were many wars that hurt over 100,000 people. Today, there are still some civil wars, but countries mostly get along better than before. However, terrorism has become a big problem in recent years. Wars have killed more civilians than soldiers since World War II. On the bright side, although deaths from violence are common, the number of murders worldwide actually went down slightly - from 8 per 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia helps people by supporting human rights. She saw that many women and girls in Bangladesh were not treated fairly after some projects stopped. Wasfia wanted to change this. She loves climbing mountains, but most people in Bangladesh have never seen one because their country is flat. So, she combined her love of climbing with helping others to make a difference. Now, more people are paying attention to the problem and trying to do something about it.

Many people think that poor countries are very bad: they're very poor, ruled by dictators, and there's no hope for change. But this isn't true! In fact, something amazing is happening. Over the past 20 years, more than 700 million people have become richer and left poverty behind. Also, every year, 6 million fewer children die from sickness, many more girls go to school, and millions of people get clean water.

Many managers try to make their feedback more positive by saying nice things before and after any criticism. But when this happens all the time, employees start to think that the nice comments are just trying to hide the bad news. This makes the good comments less important. Managers should give praise only when it's deserved, not just to soften the negative feedback.

I'm part of an organization that wants to stop robots from killing people. Some people might think of robots like those in movies, but it's not just science fiction. Right now, machines are being used to kill with very little human control. If we let this continue, we'll have 'killer robots' that can decide who to kill on their own. I think this would be very wrong and dangerous for humans. We need to be careful about what we ask machines to do.

English is learned by more people than other languages. It's also spoken in many countries. But Chinese has the most native speakers. We don't see a clear connection between how many people speak a language and how many learn it. However, there is a link between how many people learn a language and how many countries have speakers.

Your boss talks to you about your project. You worry all weekend. When you go to her office on Monday, she starts by saying good things about your work. You wonder if this is just polite talk before she tells you something important.

Born in the USA has great music, but it also talks about sad things. Behind the fun rock songs are stories about people who work hard but don't get rich or famous. Some songs tell us about people who were once happy and had big plans, but then something bad happened. The song Glory Days is about people looking back at when they were young and full of hope. Downbound Train tells the story of a man whose life fell apart after he lost his job. It's easy to imagine that the artist wrote these songs because he knew people who went through similar things.

Lewis wants more protected areas in the ocean. He thinks this can help fix the damage from people polluting and overfishing. Lewis has seen how bad things are firsthand. He's swum through coral reefs that are dying because of warmer water, and he's seen empty seas with lots of trash.

Terrie Sharp is a famous writer who knows how to tell great stories. She has won an award twice! Terrie grew up in a place with many problems, but she learned to be careful and quiet. She even knew some tricks for opening car doors, but she only used them to write her books. Now, she talks more openly and goes on TV shows like Police Today and writes at conferences in the UK.

Things don't always get better every day. Is it really possible for things to improve? Steven Pinker thinks so. He looks at how humans have made progress over time. We're living longer, healthier lives with more freedom and happiness. The problem is that some people are attacking the values of reason and science. This can be dangerous because it makes us doubt important things like democracy and working together as a global community.

Old scary movies showed characters in trouble who couldn't get help or call the police. This was hard to believe because there were no mobile phones. How can we keep horror stories exciting? No phone signal! In a scary movie, it's likely that when you really need help, your phone won't work. Or it will run out of battery just as you're trying to make a call.

The Gros Michel banana was very popular in Central America. It was easy to transport and tasted sweet. But now it's dying out again. This is happening to its replacement, the Cavendish banana too. In the 1950s, United Fruit grew many bananas by copying shoots from strong plants instead of growing them from seeds. They planted these copied shoots close together in big fields.

Spider venom helps spiders catch their food. Most spider species have this kind of venom. It makes prey animals stop moving or die, not humans. Only 25 out of many spider types can hurt people with their venom. When you get bitten by a spider, it might be painful but usually not serious. In Australia, the Sydney funnel-web spider used to cause some deaths before they developed medicine for it in 1981. But remember, don't annoy hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel threatened, they release tiny hairs that can make you itch and get stuck in your skin or eyes.

This type of horror movie was very popular many years ago. It starts with friends having fun together, but ends with everyone dying except one girl. At first, she is shy and not strong. But by the end, she becomes brave and clever. Usually, this girl survives in the end.

To understand how we got good at speaking complicated language, we need to look at what makes our brains different from other animals. It's not just about brain size; it's also important what else our brains can do and why they developed that way. There aren't many clues left behind by our ancestors to help us figure this out. One thing we can see in old human remains is how the mouth, throat, and tongue changed over time. By around 100,000 years ago, humans had learned to make complex sounds. Before then, scientists can only guess whether early humans used simple or more complicated sounds.

Girls should like arts and humanities, not maths and physics. This is because society says so. There are no good female role models for girls to look up to when it comes to science jobs. Cartoons show men as scientists, inventors, or astronauts. People think scientists are weird and don't have many friends. These ideas come from the media, but they might make girls not want to do science. If there were more women in science, girls would feel better about doing science too.

The Scallion newspaper comes out every week and is free for students in the faculty buildings. About 10,000 students read it. The paper is written and made by students themselves. People like to read it because it's fun, helps them learn about culture, and gives them experience in their work. However, printing newspapers costs a lot of money. Some students can't easily get a copy because they have to go to the university to pick one up. Also, many copies end up as trash on campus.

Girox Foods has a problem with staff leaving their jobs every year. About 12 out of 100 people leave. This might not seem bad, but in our industry, it's normal for only about 7 out of 100 to leave. We want to find out why this is happening and give advice on how to make the workplace better for employees and keep them from leaving.

The speaker said some things that are true. I think it's possible that when we're connected all the time, we might feel lonely. My generation didn't grow up with technology, so we know how to be alone and it's okay. But younger people who started using technology from a young age have different problems. They're always talking but never really being alone. This means they might not learn how to enjoy their own company. Also, they're learning to talk through messages that can be changed, which is different from real conversations with someone in front of you.

Don't always follow positive feedback with negative feedback. Only give praise sometimes, not all the time. If you only say nice things after saying something not so nice, people might stop listening to your nice words.

Your dreams can give you clues about things that are on your mind, even if you don't realize it. Many people have similar dreams like flying or falling, losing their teeth or feeling embarrassed without clothes in public. These common dreams might mean the same thing for many people. To understand what they mean to you, think about how they relate to your daily life and feelings.

Moscow has a unique problem - 35,000 wild dogs live on its streets. Some of these dogs were born in the city, while others are pets that have been abandoned. The dogs either live alone or with their friends. Scientists studied them in 2010 and found that they've adapted well to city life. They've learned it's safer to cross the street when people do, and some dogs even understand traffic lights.

Wonder is a book written by RJ Palacio, an American author. She says that she got the idea for the book when she saw a girl with a facial difference walking down the street one day. Wonder has been very popular in the United States and has won some awards already. Many schools use it to talk about important topics like bullying, friendship, and being different. A movie version is coming soon, and I'm looking forward to seeing what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe has two pet rats named Zena and Roxy. She knows people often think rats are not good pets, but she thinks they're great if you take care of them properly. Some people might be surprised to hear that rats can make nice pets. Chloe didn't like rats at first, but her friend Martin showed her his and she saw how friendly and smart they were. When one of Martin's rats had babies last year, Chloe decided to adopt two of them.

Cape Town can be a difficult place for baboons. Some have been hurt or killed in car accidents, and others have got electric shocks when playing with wires. Baboons are an endangered species, so the city council is trying to help them. They've hired people called Baboon Monitors to move the baboons out of town or catch them and take them back to nature. This has worked a bit, but it's hard to keep the baboons from coming back because they think the city is an easy place to find food.

I work for a big IT company that is based in America. Because of this, I do my job from home using the internet. This means I don't spend time traveling or chatting with colleagues. Instead, I focus on specific projects and have more flexibility. This is important to me because it allows me to take time off when my kids need me for school events or doctor's appointments. However, without set office hours, I sometimes work late into the evening and might miss dinner to finish a task.

In the 1990s, graffiti was still popular, but there was a big increase in street art all over the world. Some artists wanted to make people think about important issues like war and inequality. They created art that asked questions about these problems. Other artists just focused on making beautiful art. In South America, many street artists worked in poor areas, adding color and beauty to grey city walls.

People are constantly shown things to buy through social media, magazines, and shop windows. As a result, British people are buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping makes it easy for customers to buy without thinking too much. Big brands also sell cheap clothes that can be worn just a few times and then thrown away.

Sam looked up at the dust trail from the car driving to the Big House. The horses were bothered by flies, but didn't care about their owner's visit after ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter only comes out here when he has to, which is okay with Sam. He wants to stay out of his boss's way so he can keep his job. When Mr Carter came outside, he wiped the sweat from his neck. His shirt had wet spots that looked like maps. His skin was getting red in the sun. He usually gets a tan when he works indoors while others do the work.

In Berlin, Germany, many people were unhappy about hunting pigs because they thought it was cruel. There were strong disagreements between hunters and animal lovers. The city council listened to their concerns and decided to take a different approach. Instead of shooting the pigs, they built fences around them and made it illegal to feed them. We'll have to wait and see if this works, but it might be hard because warmer winters mean there are more pigs than before.

The Hunger Games book was inspired by Suzanne's love for ancient Greek stories. When she was young, her favorite story was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens was controlled by Crete, but the Athenians rebelled. As punishment, the king of Crete forced them to send seven boys and girls to Crete each year. The youths were taken to a big maze called the Labyrinth and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But one of the youths, named Theseus, fought the Minotaur and defeated it. Suzanne sees Katniss Everdeen as a modern-day hero like Theseus.

Zoos can teach people about protecting animals and their homes. They bring humans and animals together, which helps people understand why we need to conserve nature. Some zoos help animals that have been hurt or abandoned. These animals might have come from circuses or were once pets. Zoos also study animal behavior and how to make them healthy again.

A new trend is growing that's against consumerism – the 'buy nothing' idea. It started in Canada in the 1990s and then came to the US. People were tired of spending too much money on Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend. On Buy Nothing Day, people hold protests and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, groups organize swaps and repairs for things they already own.

Graffiti is a big question mark. Some people think it's art, while others see it as vandalism. In many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is against the rules. Many street artists have gotten in trouble with the police and had to pay money for what they did. City councils are unhappy about how much money they spend cleaning up graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

What do people in the art world think about graffiti and street art? Many people now see its value as a real art form. There have been big exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. One American artist, Elura Emerald, even put on an exhibition like this in New York in 2008. She said that artists who paint on the streets are just expressing themselves and not causing any harm. They should be praised and celebrated.

Most people have 4-6 dreams every night after they turn 10. This means they have around 2,000 dreams each year. By the time they're 80 years old, they might have had 140,000 dreams! Even if we forget most of our dreams, that's still a few thousand memories left. It's not hard to believe that sometimes a dream happens and then something similar happens in real life. This is especially true when the dream is about something that happens often in daily life.

The Hunger Games takes place in the future after North America was damaged. The country is called Panem, which has 12 poor districts controlled by the rich city of Capitol. The Capitol has complete power over everything. Each district makes different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, gives all the coal to the country. A long time ago, there was a 13th district that rebelled against the Capitol and got destroyed.

Wild animals sometimes come into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons are coming into residential areas to eat. They open trash cans and take fruit from gardens and orchards. Some brave baboons even go into people's homes and take food from the kitchen! However, baboons can be aggressive and have hurt many pet animals. As a result, many city residents don't like them being there.

Many bridge accidents happen during construction. These accidents often happen because of an engineer's mistake, like a wrong calculation. The bridge collapses under its own weight and this can be very dangerous for workers on it at the time.

George Lucas was a film director who based his stories on a famous idea called the hero's journey. Usually, the hero begins by living an ordinary life, but something happens to make them go on an adventure that changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke starts off living with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. Then he finds a message from Princess Leia inside a robot named R2D2, which is like a call to start his journey.

One way to stop a big rock from hitting Earth is to use a special kind of rocket. This idea was even in a movie called Armageddon, but it's actually a real plan proposed by NASA. The rockets are really powerful and can be used to push the asteroid off course. If the asteroid is too close to us, we could also use small nuclear bombs to blow it up.

According to Campbell, a hero usually doesn't want to go on an adventure. But then they meet someone who helps them make up their mind. They decide to take the first step and enter a new world where exciting things happen. Next, they face challenges, fight against bad people, and meet helpful friends. Luke's mentor is Obi-Wan. His friends are Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO. The bad person he has to deal with is Darth Vader inside the Death Star.

Some things might seem useless to people, but they can be useful to others. The internet has helped groups of people share these underused items and make money from them. Websites and social media groups now make it easy for people to buy and sell second-hand goods. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that our dreams show us things we're not aware of in our waking life. Freud thought that if we understand our dreams, we can learn more about our feelings and problems. But another theory said that dreams are just a mix of random thoughts in our brain as it sorts through memories from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these mixed-up images and feelings and turn them into a story.

I'm a freelancer, which means I work for myself. This is good because I have control over what I do and how I spend my time. At first, I worked from home, but it was hard to focus. There were too many things distracting me: household chores, wanting another cup of tea, and family members asking for attention. So, I started going to a nearby café to work, but the internet connection wasn't great. I also drank too much coffee! In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a shared office space with other freelancers like me. I liked getting dressed to go to work and focusing in an office environment.

NASA needs money to build a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope will help us find small and medium-sized asteroids in space. If they get the funding, it might take them about 10 years to complete this task. After finding these asteroids, NASA's planetary defence team would need to figure out how to protect Earth from the really big and dangerous ones.

Some social media influencers are now sharing a new idea - not buying anything! They usually post about things people can buy, like clothes and makeup. Some YouTube stars even tell their viewers to avoid buying stuff for a whole year. Two friends in Canada tried this challenge too. For the first three months, they learned how to live without buying things like electronics, clothes, or household items. Then, they stopped using services like haircuts, eating out, and filling up their car with gas. After one year, they had saved $55,000!

Pi's family is Hindu, but he's interested in other religions too. He befriends a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. People are surprised when Pi says he's both Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one, Pi says 'I just want to love God'. After that, they let him decide for himself what religion means to him.

Some people think writing down your dreams can help you have more control over them. Lucid dreaming means being aware you're dreaming and able to change what happens in your dream. This could be useful - you might turn a scary dream into a peaceful one, or guide the story of your dream like a movie director. Instead of just trying to understand your dreams, you'll be creating them yourself. But it's also good to have some dreams that let your subconscious mind tell you what's really on your mind.

Many people don't think about their old clothes because they give them to charity. But charity shops can't sell all these unwanted clothes. Fast fashion is popular for a short time, then it's no longer wanted. The quality is often poor, so people don't want to buy second-hand clothes. As a result, many clothes are thrown away or sent abroad, causing more environmental and economic problems.

Some people who love adventure don't stop after one exciting trip. Meagan McGrath from Canada is an example. She has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, cycled across Canada, and run a long race in the hot Sahara Desert. But her most impressive journey was to the South Pole by skiing. On the first day, she fell into a glacier and had to be rescued. Many people would have given up at that point, but Meagan decided to keep going. She finally reached the South Pole after 40 days, pulling a sledge with her tent and food through very cold weather and ice storms.

Blek le Rat started painting rats on Parisian walls when he was young. Now, he wants people to think about important social issues and problems. He paints pictures of homeless people in cities to remind people that homelessness is a big problem.

Some places have special areas for artists to paint graffiti legally. Taiwan has these 'graffiti zones' where artists can create freely. In São Paulo, Brazil, some artists are even allowed to paint on subway trains.

Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town in South Africa. She creates big, colorful paintings of people and animals. She likes to find new places to paint her art. You can see her work on pavements, in old factories, and even on abandoned cars. Faith47 enjoys that most street art doesn't last long because it gets washed away by rain or cleaned up by the city council. For her, this is like life - always changing with endings and new beginnings.

Gabriela used to work in a place where people respected those in charge. Leaders made important decisions and weren't often questioned. But her Swedish team worked differently. They were used to working together with their bosses to solve problems and make choices. Here, leaders helped others think for themselves and expected to be challenged.

Gabriela noticed some cultural differences between herself and her team. She decided to talk openly with them about their feelings towards her leadership style. Her team said they liked having more freedom to make decisions and try new things. They felt Gabriela didn't trust them when she told them exactly what to do. The team explained that they were used to being able to challenge ideas and make changes, which was normal for them.

Os Gêmeos are two brothers from São Paulo who like to paint. They make big and colorful pictures on buildings. Sometimes their paintings are so big that they need special machines to help them finish. In 2007, they even painted a whole castle in Scotland!

People have been writing and painting on walls for a long time. In olden days, people in Africa and Europe drew pictures of animals and people in caves. Archaeologists have found graffiti on buildings from ancient times in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. They even found some written messages in the Roman town of Pompeii. These messages were about love, politics, and religion. Some were even magic spells!

Do you dream of climbing high mountains or walking across long distances? Many people do! Every year, thousands of people try to climb big mountains or walk across continents. Today's adventurers use modern tools like GPS and phones to help them on their journeys. Some people travel to learn more about nature and help protect the environment. Others want to make a difference by helping those in need and raising money for good causes.

The first test is called DART. It's a special mission to hit an asteroid's moon, called Didymos. The moon is 150 meters wide and orbits around its bigger parent, which is 800 meters across. If everything goes well, the impact of DART will make the moon move out of its orbit so that we can see it from Earth using telescopes.

Katniss Everdeen, a 16-year-old girl, has lost her father. She needs to help her family by hunting for food. With her friend Gale, she becomes very good at using a bow and arrow. When her little sister Prim is chosen to participate in the Hunger Games, Katniss decides to take her place. The other person from District 12 is a boy named Peeta. Katniss starts to feel complicated feelings towards him.

Writing about your dreams helps you remember more details. Think about the people and place where the dream happened, as they might help you understand it better. After a week, you'll be surprised by how much you've written down. Then, you can start to connect your dreams to what happens in your daily life.

In the past, most bridges were made of wood. This was a problem because they easily caught fire. Old train bridges were especially at risk. The sparks from the wheels and tracks could start a fire that would destroy the bridge.

Street art is changing, but some patterns are clear. Most artists are young and paint in their city or town. However, many are now traveling and working all over the world. The internet helps them share pictures of their work and talk to each other. Street art is also getting more respect from the art world as a real form of art. We don't know what will happen next, but we can be sure that street art is here to stay!

Suzanne Collines doesn't like watching news programs about wars. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to keep bad news from her, but Suzanne still saw war news on TV and knew her dad was involved. It was very scary for her.

A big survey was done by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC). They asked over 40,000 people questions about their jobs. The topics included how they like to work, how they communicate with each other, and what they think about getting paid. The survey also looked at how people develop in their careers and balance their work and personal life.

Erik Weihenmayer is an adventurer from America. He has done many exciting things like cycling in Morocco, kayaking in the Grand Canyon, and climbing Mount Everest. What's amazing is that Erik has been blind since he was 13 years old. Besides his travels, Erik helps people with disabilities to stay active and healthy. He also takes groups of young blind people on hiking trips.

Online marketplaces are making it easy for people to make some extra money. For instance, busy parents who used to ignore local markets or car boot sales can now sell their children's old things online. They can get rid of baby clothes that are barely worn and expensive baby gear they no longer need, putting some cash back in their pockets.

Pi and Richard Parker spend 227 days on a lifeboat. They face many challenges like hunger, sickness, and tiredness. They also have to deal with big storms and hot sunshine. Despite these difficulties, they manage to survive. Pi sometimes finds comfort in his three religions, but other times he feels very lonely and sad. Eventually, the Mexican coast comes into view and everything changes. I won't tell you what happens next - you'll just have to read the book to find out!

Chloe came home from school and made a cup of coffee. Then, she went upstairs to her bedroom. She had some homework, but it could wait. Chloe wanted to relax for an hour before her parents got home. This time was nice because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA's team looked at most of the big asteroids near Earth. These 'near-Earth objects' are like mountains and are within 50 million kilometers of our planet. They found about 90% of them that are over 1km wide. There are still some left to find, but NASA says none of the ones they know about will hurt Earth.

Auggie decides to go to school. He's very nervous on his first day, like most kids who start at a new school. But it's even harder for him because of how he looks. Nobody wants to sit next to him and he notices other kids looking at him or talking about him behind their hands. Luckily, he makes friends with Jack in his class and Summer from lunchtime. However, the first day is just the beginning. Auggie soon finds out that his classmates don't want to touch him because they're afraid of getting sick. Throughout the year, Auggie faces many ups and downs until something unexpected happens at school camp that changes everything.

The two men looked towards the north part of the land. It went on forever. You couldn't even see the fences from where they were standing. Even if a teenager was very bored or stubborn, it wasn't possible to run away. Sam looked at the biggest horse and thought about whether the boy could ride it. There are many problems you can get into when riding horses far from home. But maybe there's even more trouble for someone who doesn't know how to ride and wants to escape their father.

Many people have climbed Mount Everest. Some were young, some old - all ages! Climbing high mountains can be very risky, even with good equipment and guides. But many top climbers now look for new adventures. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria started climbing when she was a teenager. She became a nurse after school, but still loved to climb whenever she could.

Gerlinde climbed Everest, then decided to climb all 14 mountains that are over 8,000 metres tall. To make it harder, she climbs without using oxygen tanks. This is a bit dangerous because high mountains have low air pressure, which can affect your brain and body. Gerlinde uses her fame as a climber to help a charity for poor children and orphans in Nepal.

When we look around our homes, we can see things we bought but don't use. For example, a thick coat we thought was cool even though we live in a hot place. Or a smartphone that got put away when we got a new one. Maybe there's a car that only gets used on weekends or a spare room that's now just for storage.

Dreams have been important throughout history and across different cultures. People used to think that dreams were messages from a higher power, giving us information or guidance. Even now, many people can remember a time when they dreamed about something and then it happened in real life.

Building bridges is a big deal. Some of the biggest and most expensive projects in the world involve building bridges. They're very important because they help cars, trucks, and trains cross rivers, mountains, or other roads. When bridges collapse, people pay close attention to how they were built.

Gabriela was very frustrated after a while, so she sent an email to her Swedish boss about problems with her team. Her boss just asked if Gabriela thought her team was still doing well and what would help her work better with her colleagues. But Gabriela didn't think her boss was taking the situation seriously.

Some dogs live together in groups. They know that humans give food to small and cute dogs more easily. So, these small dogs go around asking for food for their whole group. Some clever dogs have even learned how to use the city's metro system! Scientists are curious about how they know when to get off at the right stop. One idea is that they use their good sense of smell to recognize familiar places. Another possibility is that they learn the names of stations from announcements on the train. Whatever the reason, people who take the metro have gotten used to seeing dogs on the trains and hardly notice them anymore.

Ed Stafford from the UK walked along the Amazon River for two years and four months. He started near the Andes mountains in Peru and finished at the river's mouth in Brazil, walking a total of 6,000 kilometers. The Amazon rainforest is home to many dangers like snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars. But Ed was lucky and didn't get hurt badly. He just got some mosquito and ant bites.

In the UK, people spend around £1,000 on new clothes each year. This might not seem like much, but there are two important issues to consider. Firstly, many people buy things using credit cards. On average, adults owe about £670 to these companies. That's almost 2/3 of what they spend on clothes. Secondly, people often buy things they don't really need and then throw them away. In fact, the UK throws away around 300,000 tons of clothing each year, most of which ends up in landfills.

Ed's journey through the rainforest was only possible because of technology. He used a radio to ask people for food and permission to pass through their land. Many came to meet him and helped guide him through the tough terrain. As he walked, Ed wrote about his daily experiences on a blog. He used the attention from his trip to talk about the destruction of the rainforest and raise money for good causes in Brazil and Peru.

Many companies are now using the sharing economy because it can be very profitable. One popular business model involves creating a website that connects people who need something with those who have it to spare. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their empty rooms or houses to tourists. This way, they can earn some extra money. Another example is Uber, which lets people use their own cars as taxis and make some extra cash in their free time.

Zoos play a crucial role in helping endangered species survive. In the wild, some rare species have trouble finding partners and breeding because of poachers, habitat loss, and predators. A good zoo provides a safe space for these animals to live and breed. This is especially important when some wild populations are declining. As this happens, there's a risk that the remaining animals will become too similar genetically. Zoos help by breeding animals in a controlled environment. These zoo-bred animals can then be released back into the wild to increase genetic diversity.

Both types of accidents are very rare. However, they can happen when trains or boats hit a bridge. Trains cause damage because of their speed. Boats can also cause problems due to their size, even if they're moving slowly. To prevent these disasters, we need to plan ahead. Modern technology and safer working conditions can help reduce the risk of accidents.

At first, Pi is very scared of the animals on the boat. He jumps into the water, but then remembers that there are sharks swimming around him. He knows he can't stay in the ocean, so he climbs back onto the boat. The animals start eating each other one by one until only Pi and a tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger is feeling sick from the sea and isn't hungry right now.

When Pi was 16, his parents didn't like the new government. They were worried about their future, so they decided to leave India and move to Canada. Some animals from the zoo went to other zoos in North America, while the family sailed to Canada with some of the animals. Unfortunately, a big storm came and the ship sank. Pi's family and the sailors all died, but Pi was left alone on a lifeboat with a hyena, zebra, orangutan, and a huge tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers and young adults written by Suzanne Collins from the United States. Since it was published, it has been translated into many languages - 26 to be exact! It has sold millions of copies worldwide. This book is also special because it's the first one for young readers to sell over a million electronic copies. The Hunger Games has become a big movie too and is just as successful. In its opening weekend in North America, it made a lot of money - 152.5 million dollars!

Dreams might be how our brains organize thoughts from the day. When we're awake, our thoughts are like conversations in our minds. But when we sleep, the part of our brain that controls words becomes less active. The part that controls emotions becomes more active instead.

Having good friendships and family connections makes us happy. Research shows that most happy people have strong bonds with friends and family, and they make time for them regularly. It's also important to have one person you can talk openly with - this is called 'self-disclosure'. Having just one close friend or family member who understands you deeply is enough. You don't need many friends just to do things together or chat about hobbies. What matters most is having that deeper connection. Some people need to learn how to really listen to others to build stronger relationships.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist who believes in developing your potential, says that our brains are flexible. This means we can learn new things and get better at them even if we're not naturally good at them to start with. Many of us praise people for their natural talents or the end result they achieve. For example, 'You have a great eye for details' or 'You're really good at organizing events'. But research shows that praising how someone does something - like trying hard, experimenting and solving problems - can help them learn new skills and improve.

The rover on Mars checks the air around it from time to time. In 2014, it found something interesting - methane was present in the air. Methane is a type of gas that only lasts for a few hundred years. This means that there must be something on Mars that's making more methane appear. NASA says that Mars releases thousands of tons of methane at once. The amount of methane changes throughout the year, like a planet 'breathing' in and out.

Dr. Carol Dweck, a psychologist from Stanford University, gave some 10-year-olds problems that were just a bit too hard. Some kids liked this challenge and thought they could get better at it. They believed in themselves and focused on what they could do in the future. This is called having a 'growth mindset'. But other kids felt like their intelligence was being judged and they failed. They had a 'fixed mindset' and didn't think they could improve. Some of these kids said they might cheat next time, while others looked for someone who did worse than them to feel better about themselves.

Horror movies often take place in empty places like old hospitals, houses, or towns. There's something about these lonely areas that makes them scary. We wonder what it was like when people lived there and why they left. Maybe it's also the silence that can be very frightening. Additionally, abandoned places are useful for horror movie directors because it's believable that you won't have phone signal there either.

Horror movies often make the basement in any house look scary. This is usually where something is hiding or where someone has hidden their tools. Basements are typically dark and damp. You need to go down a narrow staircase to get there. Even when nothing is happening, basements can still be creepy.

Gary Collins, a policeman on holiday, saw people he knew on TV during the London riots. He quickly went back home to help identify them. After six months of looking at CCTV footage, he found 190 people just by looking at their eyes. His help was very important for the police investigation. Even with lots of video footage, computers were only able to find one person.

I think it's interesting to think about how we can improve ourselves by adding new parts to our bodies. Imagine if you could put a computer in your brain! In the future, we'll be able to do this and make our brains better for things like math, hearing and seeing, and remembering. This idea will become more normal as time goes on.

The speaker gave a great talk that made sense. One thing she said was interesting - how parents influence their kids. For example, if parents are on their phones all the time, it's no surprise that teenagers do the same while doing their homework. The speaker also talked about people wanting to be in two places at once. This is why they switch between talking online and in person. I've seen this with my teenage daughter and her friends. They plan to meet up but then just sit there, each one chatting online.

Some news stories make us think the world is getting more violent. But there are also reasons to be hopeful. Between World War II and 1990, there were many wars that killed over 100,000 people. Today, countries mostly get along better than before. However, terrorism has become a big problem in recent years. Since World War II, most war victims have been civilians. On the other hand, even though violent crime is more common than political conflict, the number of murders worldwide has actually gone down slightly.

Wasfia has spent her life helping people have their human rights respected. She saw that many projects to help women and girls in Bangladesh didn't last, leaving them with nothing. Wasfia wanted to make a difference so she combined two things she loves - climbing mountains and fighting for human rights. This way, she could try to change how people think about women in her country.

Most people think that countries with few resources are in a bad situation - very poor, controlled by leaders who don't care about their people, and no chance for things to get better. But, surprisingly, this isn't true. In fact, something amazing is happening. Over the past 20 years, more than 700 million people have become richer and left poverty behind. At the same time, six million fewer children die each year from illnesses, many more girls are going to school, and millions of people now have access to clean water.

Many managers try to make their feedback more helpful by putting some nice comments around a criticism. But when this happens all the time, employees might start thinking that the nice comments are just trying to hide the bad news. This makes the good things said seem less important. Instead, we should say something positive to help people do better and feel motivated.

I'm part of a group called the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. People often think of robots like those in movies, but this is different. Right now, military machines like drones and robots are being used to kill with very little human control. In the future, we might see 'murderbots' that can decide who to kill on their own. I believe this would be very wrong and dangerous for humans. We need to think carefully about what we ask machines to do.

English is the most popular language to learn, with more people learning it than any other language. It's also spoken in the most countries around the world. Although Chinese has the largest number of native speakers, English is still widely used. Interestingly, there isn't a clear link between how many people speak a language and how many people learn it. However, there is a connection between the number of learners and the number of countries where the language is spoken.

My manager stops me and wants to talk about my work on the recent project. I worry all weekend about what might have gone wrong. On Monday morning, she starts by saying how well I did on the project. I think maybe this is just a nice thing to say before giving feedback. I know that usually, people start with something good, then say what they really want to say, and finish with something else positive.

Born in the USA is a rock album with fast-paced songs that make you want to move your feet. But the lyrics are also very emotional. The songs tell stories about people who work hard but don't get rich or famous. They're angry and sad because life doesn't turn out like they hoped. For example, Glory Days is about people looking back at when they were young and had everything they wanted. Downbound Train tells the story of a man whose life falls apart after he loses his job. It's easy to imagine that the artist is writing about real people he knows or what could have happened if he hadn't become famous. This album shows how talented the singer, known as the Boss, really is.

Lewis wants to see more marine protected areas in the world. He thinks this will help fix the damage caused by humans, like overfishing and pollution. Lewis has seen this damage himself during his travels. He's swum over coral reefs that are dying because of warmer water, and he's seen underwater deserts with no life and lots of plastic waste. Lewis believes nature can recover if we give it a chance. But time is running out. If we don't take care of our oceans, we might have a big problem that's hard to fix.

Terrie Sharp is a successful author who has won the Olive Crime Writer Award twice. She grew up in a part of Glasgow with high crime rates, where she learned to be careful and keep out of trouble. But instead of using these skills for bad things, Terrie used them to write her books. Now, she's not shy anymore and often appears on TV shows like Police Today and at writing events across the UK.

Is life getting better or worse? Steven Pinker thinks things are actually improving. People are living longer, healthier lives with more freedom and happiness. The real issue is that some people don't value reason and science like they used to. When leaders and politicians appeal to people's emotions instead of facts, it can cause big problems for important things like democracy and working together as a global community.

In old horror movies, characters in trouble couldn't easily get help or call the police. This was because they didn't have mobile phones. Now that we do have them, it's less believable for characters to be stuck without a way to ask for help. So, what's the solution? No phone signal! In scary films, heroes often find themselves in tricky situations where they really need to call for help. But just when they try, they don't get any signal or their phone runs out of battery.

In the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America were facing a big problem. Their most popular banana, called Gros Michel or Big Mike, was dying out. Now, something similar is happening to its replacement, the Cavendish banana. The Gros Michel banana plant was very successful because it had thick skin and sweet fruit that was easy to transport. United Fruit, the main company growing bananas in South America at the time, grew their bananas in large fields by taking cuttings from existing plants rather than using seeds. This made them very efficient.

Most spiders have venom that helps them catch their food or kill it. It's not meant to hurt humans. Only 25 out of many spider species can really harm people, and even then, most spider bites are just painful but not deadly. In Australia, there was a problem with the Sydney funnel-web spider until they developed an antidote in 1981. But be careful when you touch hairy spiders like tarantulas - if they feel threatened, they release tiny hairs that can get stuck in your skin or eyes.

This type of horror movie was very popular a long time ago. It usually starts with a group of teenagers having fun, but ends with everyone dying except one girl. At first, this girl is shy and not strong. By the end, she becomes brave and clever. Most of the time, the last girl survives.

To understand how we developed our ability for complex language, we need to look at what makes our brains different from other animals. This isn't just about brain size; it's also important to know what else our brains can do and why they evolved that way. Unfortunately, there aren't many physical clues left behind by our ancestors to help us figure out what kind of speech they used. However, we can see how the mouth, throat, and tongue developed in early humans. By around 100,000 years ago, humans had learned to make complex sounds. Before then, scientists can only guess whether early humans communicated using simpler sounds or not.

Society tells us that girls should like arts and humanities, while boys are better at maths and physics. This is not true. There aren't many good female role models for young girls to look up to in science jobs. In cartoons and stories, scientists are often men who are crazy, genius, or adventurous. People think scientists are weird, don't have friends, and work alone. These ideas come from the media, but they might make girls not want to be scientists because it seems uncool. If there were more women in science jobs, girls would feel more confident and happy about those subjects.

The Scallion is a weekly newspaper that students make themselves. It's free and available in all the buildings on campus. About 10,000 students read it every week. The paper is important to students and staff because they enjoy reading about entertainment, culture, and work experiences. However, printing newspapers costs a lot of money. Some students can't easily get a copy because they have to go to the university to pick one up. This isn't very good for the environment either, as many papers end up on the ground as litter.

Girox Foods has a problem with staff leaving. About 12% of our workers leave each year. This might not seem bad, but in our industry, it's normal for only 7% to go. Our goal is to understand why people are unhappy and suggest ways to make the workplace better for them.

This isn't a problem for my age group because we grew up without technology and know how to be alone. We also know it's okay to be alone sometimes. But younger people, those under 20, are different. They're always talking online and never get used to being by themselves. This means they might not learn how to enjoy their own company. Also, they're learning how to talk through messages that can be changed, which is different from having real conversations with someone in front of you.

When you give praise and criticism together, good comments might not be taken seriously anymore. It's better to sometimes just say something nice without trying to fix anything. This way, people will still appreciate your kind words.
